Sentencas: Mixed oxides belonging to the La(2)Sr(n-2)TinO(3n+1) family have been targeted as potential materials for high performance anodes in fuel cells.
Titulo: Characterisation of Novel Anodes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Based on Oxygen-Excess Perovskite Related Structures

Sentencas: The most important feature of these ompounds is the existence of excess oxygen along preferential directions.
Titulo: Characterisation of Novel Anodes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Based on Oxygen-Excess Perovskite Related Structures

Sentencas: Substitution by lower valence cations might lead to a removal of this excess oxygen along preferential directions and therefore possibly increase the potential for ionic conductivity.
Titulo: Characterisation of Novel Anodes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Based on Oxygen-Excess Perovskite Related Structures

Sentencas: High total conductivity (>1 S.cm(-1)) was found after reduction for some compounds within this family of compounds.
Titulo: Characterisation of Novel Anodes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Based on Oxygen-Excess Perovskite Related Structures

Sentencas: The activation energy varied with the structure and the more disordered the structure (thicker perovskite blocks), the lower the activation energy was found.
Titulo: Characterisation of Novel Anodes for Solid Oxide Fuel Cells Based on Oxygen-Excess Perovskite Related Structures
